result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Concentration (>=.25)] was dismissed by the court.

  • John R Henz was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment as directed by probation agent.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

$2,900 fine plus costs including court appointed attorney fees. Cash bond applied.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicle driven by or registered to Defendant during period of IID restriction must be equipped with Ignition Interlock Device unless otherwise ordered by the Court.
Obtain alcohol assessment through Door County Human Services and comply with treatment recommendations.  Defendant attended the 2/11/16 Door/Kewaunee Victim Impact Panel.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Ct. 1. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of Ct. 1. Court dismisses Ct. 2 and 15-TR-1155 but reads in for sentencing.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge. Court orders PSI. Bond remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer indicates defendant no longer wishes to take either matter to trial, requests a plea and sentencing date. State has no objection to continuance. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.
State's Discovery Demand

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.   Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
Defense Discovery Demand
Audio/Video Supplementary Discovery Demand

Defendant John R Henz in court with attorney Linda Jean Schaefer.  Defendant John R Henz in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Schaefer accepts court appointment. Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:45 am.

Defendant John R Henz in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant is now requesting a court appointed attorney as he doesn't qualify for PD representation. Court appoints Atty Linda Schaefer to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $100 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 9/30/15. Atty Schaefer is due back in court later this afternoon. Court will recall case at 3:45 pm.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant John R Henz in court, in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel at this point, would like time to meet with ADA Korb to discuss both cases. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 11:15 am.
amending Ct. 1 from OWI 3rd to OWI 4th and adding Ct. 2, PAC charge.

Defendant John R Henz in court.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.   Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Defendant to make appointment with DA.  Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/12/15 by jail staff.

Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant John R Henz appears by video conference.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for PD representation. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
